options.content: Complete lesson plan. Appropriate relevant chunking, sequence of goals / obj., sufficient # of trials, items, types & available
Complete lesson plan. Some instructional details need to be clarified. Plan needs minor revisions.
Incomplete or unclear lesson plan requiring extensive revisions. Unclear expectations and/or objectives.
No lesson plan
Included appropriate review  /  maintenance  /  prerequisite, with clear format
included inappropriate  /  partial review  /  maintenance  /  prerequisite, and / or unclear format
Included inappropriate  /  no review  /  maintenance  /  prerequisite, and / or unclear format
Included appropriate objective, link, and relevance statement
Included inappropriate / partial objective, link, and relevance statement
Included inappropriate / no objective, link, and relevance statement
Skill broken into clear steps, modeled skill, appropriate format, engages student
Skill broken into unclear steps or did not model skill, inappropriate format
Skill broken into unclear steps or did not model skill, inappropriate format
Appropriate cue and pace, necessary prompts, sufficient # of examples, aligned to objective
No supervision or responses not directed, or inappropriate pace, or not aligned to objectives
No supervision or responses not directed, or inappropriate pace, or not aligned to objectives
Appropriate real-life examples
Provides some real-life examples, examples are unclear or unrelated
Provides no real-life examples or inappropriate examples
Appropriate supervision / feedback, sufficient # of trials, varied examples, aligned to objective
Inappropriate supervision / feedback, or not aligned to objective
Inappropriate supervision / feedback, or not aligned to objective
Generalized across materials, people and / or settings, scheduled practice opportunities, aligned to objective
Random or unpredictable practice opportunities, not aligned to objective
Started on time, materials gathered and ready for use, students arranged to optimize learning
Did not start on time, some / all materials missing, ineffective arrangement
Followed format or script in written program  /  ETC
Followed format or script in written program  /  ETC but was not fluent
Followed portions of format of script of written program  /  ETC
Did not follow format and / or script in written program  /  ETC
Frequent eye contact and frequent scanning of group
Some eye contact and / or infrequent scanning of group
Little or not eye contact and / or not scanning of group
Appropriately adapted program to meet individual needs
Adapted program but adaptations were not individualized to the extent needed by student
Did not adapt program to meet individual students needs or inappropriate adaptations made
Appropriate enthusiasm, tone, and volume, relates positive attitude, age appropriate, consistently uses smooth phrasing and emphasizes key words
Little / excessive enthusiasm, tone, and volume, interferes with student learning / behavior, generally uses smooth phrasing and generally emphasizes key words
Little or no enthusiasm, tone, and volume, interferes with student learning / behavior, does not use smooth phrasing, no emphasis of key words
Correct sequence included 90-100% of the time (attention, cue, pause, signal), signal only needed when appropriate
Correct sequence (see list) included 70-89% of the time
Correct sequence (see list) included less than 69% of the time
Positively stated at beginning of lesson, and provides necessary directions to start lesson, find page, get supplies, etc.
Negatively stated or not included, and / or does not provide necessary directions to start lesson, find page, get supplies, etc.
Consistently  /  effectively follows behavior management plan to address appropriate and problem behavior
Inconsistently  /  ineffectively follows behavior management plan to address appropriate and problem behavior
Does not consistently  /  effectively follow behavior management plan

rows.info:
1. Varied academic & behavior
2. Contingent
3. Descriptive
4. Non-disruptive

options.content: All 4 components of good reinforcement observed
2-3 components observed
0-1 components observed
Consistently  /  effectively implemented prompting procedures, prompting procedures used appropriate for student(s)
Inconsistently  /  ineffectively implemented prompting procedures, prompting procedures used appropriate for student(s)
Does not consistently  /  effectively implement prompting procedures, incorrect prompting procedures used
Aware of environment, is proactive, appropriate unprogrammed interactions, "thinks on feet"
2-3 components observed
0-1 components observed
Efficient use of time and progresses through lesson appropriately, efficient transitions
Partially efficient use of time and / or progresses through parts of lesson appropriately, some efficient transitions
Inefficient use of time and / or does not progress through lesson appropriately, inefficient transitions
All components present 80% or more of the time
One or more components present less then 50% of the time (see list)
One or more components present less then 50% of the time (see list)
Praise / redirect ratio at least 3:1; praise rate appropriate for group  /  individual
Praise / redirect ratio of at least 2:1
Praise / redirect ratio less than 2:1
Consistently included frequent opportunities to respond and relevant combinations of individual / group / dispersed turns
Inconsistently included frequent opportunities to respond, and / or lacks relevant combinations of individual / group / dispersed turns
Inadequate opportunities to respond, lacks relevant combinations of individual / group / dispersed turns
Data recorded accurately and aligned to objective, information on data sheet complete
No data recorded or recorded inaccurately, data recorded does not align to the objective
Records indicate data has been recorded previously with a minimum of 5 data points, form is neat and legible
No records of data recorded previously, form not legible or easily understood
Appropriate instructional / behavior management decisions made and based on recorded data and objective
Instructional / behavior management decisions made subjectively, but not based on recorded data
Inappropriate instructional / behavior management decisions made
Previous data is appropriate graphed, axis labeled, phase change lines included, no missed sessions without explanation
Some previous data is graphed, axis labeled, phase change lines included, graph is not completed daily during inst. sessions
No records of data recorded previously
Able to articulate trends in data and identify need to change and appropriate actions to take
With support articulates trends in data and identify need to change and appropriate actions to take
Does not sufficiently articulate trends, needs, and actions to take

info: Refer to USU Department of Special Education and Rehabilitation Professional Guidelines

rows.info:
1. Meet the standards of the school district, program or clinic assigned
2. Must wear a photo ID name tag

options.content: Dresses appropriately and maintains personal hygiene
Does not dress appropriately and / or does not maintain personal hygiene

rows.info:
1. Accepts feedback
2. Acknowledges need for improvement,
3. Asks questions for clarification,
4. Immediately implements recommended changes

options.content: Responds appropriately to feedback
Does not respond appropriately to feedback

rows.info:
1. Implements changes in behavior, procedure, or schedule as recommended
2. Checks with person who provided feedback to receive input on whether implementation is correct

options.content: Correctly implements changes after being given feedback
Does not correctly implement changes after being given feedback

rows.info:
Exhibits appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication
(i.e., tone of voice, facial expression, gestures, etc.)
when interacting with teachers, classroom staff, and students.

options.content: Exhibits positive and respectful attitude in the classroom
Does not exhibit positive and respectful attitude in the classroom

rows.info:
Effective team member, appropriate levels of independence, constructive verbal messages,
listen to and understands feedback, self / social awareness, self / relationship management,
accepts responsibility, self-control, expresses self appropriately, generalized information

options.content: Demonstrates many or all professional attributes
Does not demonstrate or only sometimes demonstrates professional attributes
